intro: Oxydectes abutiloides, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Oxydectes abutiloides is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its tolerance to drought conditions.
